column5: I reticently purchased a new computer and the 30 day Microsoft office has now expired and I have to purchase the software I mostly just use Word and have no need for power point and Excell. . Is it called 365 because you have to renew every year?  any help appreciated  Thanks
Yes, Office 365 is a subscription based online service. You pay monthly or yearly renewal for the service.
Must be run by the Canadian government now ! Next thing, I will have to get a sticker for my computer
You could see what the price of ms word is to purchase on its own instead of renewing 365 if that is an option.
Open Office is a full featured office suite with a word processor.  You can download it for free here.
Thanks for the link Works great !
walleye 72, will people with Word be able to open and read Open Office files?
Yes, save it as a word file ( it is an option) I have used open office for years on my Mac with zero issues.  G
http://www.libreoffice.org/ is a more supported then openoffice in my option.  It was a fork of openoffice.
